body_html:
Here is the output. The first thing is that warning. @kchodorow

But I have to repeat that it is in fact using the proxy information in http_proxy. Normally, our network restricts any connection to the external networks, only through HTTP(S) proxies.

user@hostname:~/tensorflow-1.1.0$ bazel fetch "//tensorflow/... -//tensorflow/contrib/nccl/... -//tensorflow/examples/android/..."
Warning: ignoring http_proxy in environment.
.........
INFO: Downloading http://bazel-mirror.storage.googleapis.com/github.com/google/protobuf/archive/2b7430d96aeff2bb624c8d52182ff5e4b9f7f18a.tar.gz: 626,737 bytes

body:
Here is the output. The first thing is that warning. @kchodorow 

But I have to repeat that it is in fact using the proxy information in `http_proxy`. Normally, our network restricts any connection to the external networks, only through HTTP(S) proxies.

```
user@hostname:~/tensorflow-1.1.0$ bazel fetch "//tensorflow/... -//tensorflow/contrib/nccl/... -//tensorflow/examples/android/..."
Warning: ignoring http_proxy in environment.
.........
INFO: Downloading http://bazel-mirror.storage.googleapis.com/github.com/google/protobuf/archive/2b7430d96aeff2bb624c8d52182ff5e4b9f7f18a.tar.gz: 626,737 bytes

```
